That should be "hefty hardware" for EQ II.  =P

"October Country...that country where it is always turning late in the year...that country whose people are autumn people, thinking only autumn thoughts."  ---- Ray Bradbury


"Autumn, the springtime of death." --- Tom Robbins



----- Original Message ----
From: Jennifer Dury <glitterbat3113@...>
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, September 2, 2007 2:12:22 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] I need help pleaseeeeee.....

Go to www.station. com.  Under PC games you'll find EQ and EQ II.  II takes some pretty hefty hardware to run, but if you click on EQ there should be a link there for the free trial.

Welcome!

Athiarna
Bristlebane Server

----- Original Message ----
From: Ramona <ramona2u2@yahoo. com>
To: EverQuest@yahoogrou ps.com
Sent: Sunday, September 2, 2007 11:54:42 AM
Subject: [EverQuest] I need help pleaseeeeee. ....

Some co-workers were talking about Everquest and it sounded like a
great game. They said there was a free or trial download so I could
give it a try this weekend. I thought what a perfect opportunity to
try it while I have a couple of days off.

Well, my problem is that I don't know what site to download the game
from or what version. I mean there is a Everquest 2 and there are 7
day trials and a 30 day one but only if you are on a certain server
etc. I'm so confused and I haven't even started the game...lol.

So, if anyone knows of the best site to download from I'd really
appreciate it. I can't call my co-workers since I dont know their
phone numbers off hand. I guess I'd like to be able to have the
download from a place that has several servers so I can find my co-
workers on there when I see them next.

Oh by the way I'm not sure if this makes a difference when
downloading etc. but after talking with my co-workers about
characters/classes etc. I decided I would like to be an Elf :)

Thanks a bunch in advance for all of your help and hope to see you
playing Everquest soon!

thx,

Ramona
